summary:
"I am the Queen of Solitude, daughter of the Emperor! Summon the daedra! I'll trade the soul of every last subject of mine for a little comfort."
―Queen Potema, 3E 97
descriptionHtml:
[center]"I am the Queen of Solitude, daughter of the Emperor! Summon the daedra! I'll trade the soul of every last subject of mine for a little comfort."
―Queen Potema, 3E 97[/center]

[center]
Have you ever wanted to summon more daedra in Skyrim?[/center][center]If so, then this is the mod for you.
Even if that's not the case, this could still be the mod for you.

[b]WHAT DOES IT DO?
Summon the Daedra[/b] adds ten new conjuration spells to the game, which can be found in a chest outside Riverwood.

[b]MAN, THAT SOUNDS AWESOME. DOES IT HAVE ANY REQUIREMENTS?[/b]
You need the following:
- A copy of The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim (honestly if you don't have that, I don't know why you're even looking at this mod)
- The Dawnguard DLC
- A computer
- An internet connection
- A beating heart (hopefully you've got one of them)
- A copy of the Communist Manifesto (this one might be a lie)

[b]WHAT SPELLS AND DAEDRA ARE INCLUDED?
[/b]Of course I'm not telling you everything, as mystery is the spice of life (or some saying along those lines), but know ye this that with this mod you can summon the warlike Xivilai, feisty Banekin, monstrous Knights of Order, pesky Scamps, fearsome Hellhounds, highly dangerous Daedrats and more!

[b]IS THERE ANYTHING ELSE I NEED TO KNOW?[/b]
As it stands, there are no known compatibility issues or bugs. If you find one, please tell me so that it can be repaired.[/center]
author: Connordor
